result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Stanley Richmond

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James Stanley Richmond in court.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for James Stanley Richmond.  Prosecuting attorney Elaine B. Fehrs appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Restitution Hearing on case 21CM414.  Defense counsel advises Court that defendant stipulates to restitution requested amount.  Court orders restitution in the amount of $2,582.94 made payable to TC.  Court orders restitution to be paid first.

Defendant James Stanley Richmond appeared in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for James Stanley Richmond.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 3: Defendant ordered to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, credit of 56 days time serve, consecutive to cases 21CM1674 and count 4 and concurrent to case 21CM414 and count 4 on case 22CM2203. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months

AS TO COUNT 4:   Defendant ordered to serve 30 days in the House of Correction, credit of 56 days time serve, concurrent to cases 21CM1674 and count 4 on 22CM2203 and consecutive to count 3 on case 22CM2203. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months

Conditions of Probation: 
- Complete a batters intervention program.
- Complete a parenting class.
- Mental health assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Comply with any recommended treatment of the agent.
- No use of possession of firearms.
- Full time work, school or a combination.
- No contact with victim.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Pay the Domestic Abuse Assessment fee.
- Court will set restitution at next court date.

- Court WAIVES all non-mandatory costs, fees and surcharges.  Defendant to pay mandatory costs and surcharges (including DNA and DV) during period of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

Defendant advised of appeal rights.

Defendant James Stanley Richmond appeared in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for James Stanley Richmond.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

AS TO COUNTS 3 AND 4: Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank. 

AS TO COUNTS 1 AND 2:  Court orders counts 1 and 2 dismissed but read in for the purposes of sentencing.

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant James Stanley Richmond appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for James Stanley Richmond.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Plea Hearing.  However, due to the lateness of the hour, Court will pass the case until 1:45 pm.
Restitution hearing scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James Stanley Richmond not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty appeared by video for James Stanley Richmond.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Matter scheduled for Status Conference.  Defense counsel has filed plea documents.  State has not complied with victim notification and cannot proceed with plea hearing.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Received and Filed. Defendant's sentence credit
Received and Filed. Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Received and Filed. Jury Instructions - Theft

Defendant James Stanley Richmond not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joel Alan Mogren Aty in court for James Stanley Richmond.  Prosecuting attorney Julie D Knyszek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
State's Bail Motion held.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies bail motion.  All other conditions of bail to remain.  Defense counsel request plea and sentencing hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with K L G; No Violent or Disorderly Conduct with Froedtert Hospital (Emergency or Medical Contact allowed).
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant James Stanley Richmond appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor appeared by video for James Stanley Richmond. Attorney Michael J. Odden appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Skwierawski, Branch 41.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
